dialogues.text: Cole is seated on the front stoop of his brownstone.  On steps and on the landing are his plastic soldiers in the a war. Malcolm sits with his bag and overcoat on the step next t Malcolm just observes quietly.  Beat. Cole glances up as he plays.  Sees Malcolm's expression.

dialogues.text: You want to ask me a question?

dialogues.text: See, this is why I lose at poker.   Yes, I do have a question. On the step are two rows of soldiers facing each other. side are a couple soldiers covered by a tissue.  Malcolm to them.

dialogues.text: What happened to those two?  Being  under tissue paper can't be a good  thing. Cole removes the tissue.

dialogues.text: April or March of Eighty-seven.   Two weeks into sessions with  Vincent Gray.  I was treating a  couple, Donald and Robin Wagner,  who had lost their child to  Leukemia.  They were waiting with  Vincent in the reception room of  the downtown clinic.  They were  alone together maybe fifteen  minutes.  When I entered the room,  all three were crying.  The  Wagner's progress from that  afternoon was dramatic and sudden ....  As if some door had been  opened for them. (beat)

Some horizontal, some vert The writing moves in arcs and flows in various size -- wr great speed -- every word connected by a single pen strok everything written in one continuous motion. dialogues.text: You ask a lot of questions about my  dad today.  How come? Cole is playing behind the couch.  All we see is the top head.

dialogues.text: Sometimes, we don't even know it,  but we do things to draw attention.   Do things so we can express how we  feel about issues...  Divorce or  whatever. Every now and then we get glimpses of things Cole is play peeking over the back of the couch, but we can't quite ma what he's doing.

dialogues.text: One night, as an example...  leave  something on a desk for someone to  find. The top of Cole's head stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, have you ever heard of  something called free-writing?  Or  free-association writing? Cole shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.text: It's when you put a pencil in your  hand and put the pencil to a paper  and you just start writing...  You  don't think about what you're  writing...  You don't read over  what you're writing...  You just  keep your hand moving. Cole has become very still.  He looks right at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After awhile if you keep your hand  moving long enough, words and  thoughts start coming out you  didn't even know you had in you...   Sometimes they're things you heard  from somewhere...  Sometimes  they're feelings deep inside... (beat)

dialogues.text: Have you ever done any free- association writing, Cole? Beat.  Cole nods, "Yes."

dialogues.text: What'd you write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Words.

dialogues.text: What kind of words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset words. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever write any upset words  before your father left? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. Malcolm watches him carefully.  Beat.  Malcolm waves the off casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do something for me? Malcolm smiles.  He rises and grabs his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what you want from our  time together.  What our goal  should be?

dialogues.text: Something I want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: STANLEY CUNNINGHAM is a teacher in his late forties.  He question on the board.

dialogues.text: S-ssstop that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: You just kept the penny in that  hand the whole time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who me? Malcolm smiles a mischievous smile.  He places the penny table.  Cole stares at it and then looks to Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole... Cole looks at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day... (beat)

dialogues.text: (almost inaudible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: (too quick)

dialogues.text: --No. Beat.  Tommy looks to Darren and then back to Cole.

dialogues.text: ...Okay.

dialogues.text: Oh, man.

dialogues.text: That's too much. The mother pours some into the bottle.  The remainder goe the child's soup.  She replaces the cap and puts the bott in the closet. The image of the mother turns to the bed carrying the tra places the food on a metallic rolling table and swings it the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyra, time for lunch. Kyra pretends to wake from a deep sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling much better now. The image of the mother smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad, honey. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for your food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go outside, if I eat this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.  You know how you get  sick in the afternoon. Kyra picks up the spoon and takes a sip.  Her face crinkl the taste.  She looks up at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (video tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it tastes funny.  You  know I don't like to hear that. Kyra slowly brings the spoon to her mouth and swallows an spoonful. The father SHUTS OFF THE TELEVISION with his trembling ha presses his hands to his eyes like they're burning. The ROOM IS UTTERLY SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Collins is seated at the dining room surrounded by f and family.  She fixes one of the many bouquets of flower table.  It takes her a beat before she feels the stare.  She looks up. Standing in the doorway to the dining room is Mr. Collins group of ashen faced guests stand in the distance behind Husband and wife's eyes meet.  Mrs. Collins smiles softly Mr. Collins' eyes tremble with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were keeping her sick... The whole world stops. The mother's face registers confusion at first.  Then slo realization.  Her eyes glace at the many faces around her She looks back at her husband.  His glare is painful.  Ra filling every cell of his body.  Tears falling faster dow cheeks. Mrs. Collins turns her attention back to the flowers.  Sh concentrates with all her strength.  Beat.  Her hands beg shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of her... Her words are met with ice cold stares.  The first tears down her face.  The pretty flowers of consolation in her tumble to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole sits on the swings next to Kyra's four-year-old sist doesn't look up. Malcolm waits in the driveway.  Watches them from a dista Cole reaches into his pocket and pulls out the little FIN PUPPET.  He holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked it, she said. The four-year-old stares at the finger puppet, then quiet it in her small hands. The two children don't say anything for a while.  Malcolm to the house, where all movements in and out of the home ceased. Cole turns to the four-year-old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watched out for you. The little girl finally looks up.  She has the saddest ey FOUR YEAR OLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyra's not coming back. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. The little girl stares down at the finger puppet.  Cole l places a hand on her shoulder. Nothing else is said.  Nothing else is done. Malcolm looks across the two children on the swings.  One mourning.  One consoling. Malcolm takes it in, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley Cunningham moves between two curtains and comes t room door in the back.  He puts an ear to the door, liste then knocks.  After a second, he enters. Mr. Cunningham finds Cole sitting in a poor villager cost FEMALE TEACHER kneels next to him and makes final adjustm Cole and the woman glance at Mr. Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're calling for the stable boy. Mr. Cunningham looks around the room and then directly at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were you talking to? The Female Teacher looks to Cole and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Stanley. She stands up.  The entire left side of her face has been horribly.  Grotesquely disfigured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My favorite student.

dialogues.speaker: SHE DISAPPEARS INTO THE DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: Cole puts on his tattered hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for giving me this part, Mr.  Cunningham. Mr. Cunningham smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Cole. They share a look before walking out of the prop room and entering the hall. We see them walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know when I was in school,  there was a terrible fire in this  section of the theater.  They  rebuilt the whole thing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It begins to rain.  Malcolm pulls his jacket over his hea scurries up the stairs of the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm stands and catches his breath in the corridor of Anthony's Academy. A teacher rushes in the hall with an armload of costumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the play started yet? The teacher hurries past Malcolm and down the hall withou a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a yes? The teacher scurries around a corner.  Malcolm watches he curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm moves quickly to a set of double doors and opens He steps into the DARKNESS OF THE AUDITORIUM. The play is in full swing...  Cole and a large group of c children are on stage.  Cole holds a broom and wears a wo costume.  He stands to the side -- hidden by others. A boy in a shiny-armored costume walks to the center of t where a large cardboard stone is seated.  A sparkling HAN sticks out of the top. The armored boy tries to lift it.  It won't budge. Bobby, the chubby boy from the party, is dressed in a mag costume.  He is Merlin.  He steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only he who is pure of heart can  take the sword from the stone. Merlin looks to the group on stage.  Looks right at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let the boy try. The group of villagers on the stage LAUGH AND MOCK THE SU Tommy Tammisimo is dressed in a mismatched costume -- he around, clearly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-heartedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's the stable boy.  He cleans  after the horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence village idiot!  Let the boy  step forward. Tommy turns a deep shade of red and hobbles off the stage Merlin looks to Cole.  He smiles a true friend's smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... Cole hesitates.  Not because he's acting.  He really hesi It takes him a moment before he steps forward. Cole steps up to the stone.  He places his hand around th handle.  Begins to pull.  The sword starts to come out. The villagers GASP. Cole raises the shiny sword out of the stone and high abo head. Merlin and everyone on stage bows.  A SILENCE FILLS THE  AUDITORIUM. Malcolm watches his client, standing unafraid in the spot for the first time. The villagers rise and rush to Cole.  They scoop him up a him around the stage in celebration.  Cole chuckles and t starts laughing as the group of eight-year-olds try  unsuccessfully to keep him up.  They slowly sag and then  collapse.  All the students are laughing as they try to u themselves. Malcolm watches with utter joy as Cole becomes indistingu among of a group of twenty children giggling and enjoying themselves on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain comes down a little stronger now on the stained window. Malcolm sits on the stairs in the lobby.  Cole walks back forth in front of him.  Cole still holds the sword from t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come we're so quiet? Malcolm shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we said everything we  needed to say. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to say things to  someone else?  Someone close to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Cole keeps moving.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to see you anymore,  am I? Malcolm doesn't respond for a while.  He shakes his head, Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great in the play, Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Tammisimo sucked big time. Cole smiles huge.  Beat.  Cole's sword drags on the tile continues to circle around the hall.  We get the idea he want to be still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Maybe we can pretend we're going  to see each other tomorrow? Cole glances at Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for pretend. Beat.  Malcolm exhales very slowly as he gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Cole, I'm going to go now...   I'll see you tomorrow. Cole watches as Malcolm walks down the stairs to the entr Cole stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow. Malcolm's face shows his losing battle against his emotio doesn't turn to look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rain-soaked bridge.  A two-lane road merges to one lane a severe car accident.  A rear-ended car has jumped the s and hit the guard rail of the bridge.  The driver is help by police.  He's shaken but okay.  Police flares guide th as they crawl by. Lynn and Cole are standing still in bumper-to-bumper traf Lynn leans her chin on the steering wheel.  She tries to through the layer of water on the glass.  She hits the wi wipers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope nobody got hurt. Beat.  Lynn glances over to Cole who sits in his seat sil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very quiet. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad I missed the play,  aren't you? Cole shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two jobs, baby.  You know  how important they are for us. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd give anything to have been  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to communicate with you  now. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communicate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you my secrets. The way he says the words gives Lynn a chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Cole takes a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that accident up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lady.  She died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Lynn leans over the steering wheel.  She wipes the windsh with her palm to see better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Lynn gazes out the windshield at the line of red tail lig Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing next to my window.

dialogues.speaker: RAIN AND BLOOD, STANDS STARING THROUGH COLE'S PASSENGER W
dialogues.text: Lynn looks over slowly.  She doesn't see anything outside window.  She eyes Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, you're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scare me too sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghosts. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see ghosts, Cole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to do things for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk to you? Cole nods, "Yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell you to do things? Cole nods "Yes" again.  Lynn becomes upset.  She nods wit understanding.  Cole watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a freak? Lynn's eyes moves to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my face. Cole gazes at her intense expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never think that about you ...  ever... Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. BEAT.  Cole smiles a tiny smile.  Lynn glances down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me think for a second. She drowns in her thoughts.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma says hi. Lynn looks up sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says she's sorry for taking the  bumble bee pendant.  She just likes  it a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma comes to visit me sometimes. Lynn becomes still.  Her face is unreadable.  When she sp her words are extremely controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, that's very wrong.  Grandma's  gone.  You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted me to tell you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole, please stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted me to tell you, she saw  you dance. Lynn's eyes lock on Cole's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said when you were little, you  and her had a fight right before  your dance recital.  You thought  she didn't come to see you dance.   She did. Lynn brings her hands to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hid in the back so you wouldn't  see...  She said you were like an  angel. Lynn begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said, you came to her where  they buried her.  Asked her a  question...  She said the answer is  "Everyday." Lynn covers her face with her hands.  The tears roll out her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you ask? Beat.  Lynn looks at her son.  She barely gets the words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I make her proud? Cole moves closer to Lynn.  She cradles him in her arms. and son hold each other tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm walks quietly down the sidewalk towards his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm enters the living room and smiles at what he sees Anna is asleep in a chair.  She's curled up in a ball.  I she looks like a little girl. Their WEDDING VIDEO PLAYS SOFTLY ON THE TELEVISION. Malcolm watches himself and Anna cutting their wedding ca CROWD APPLAUDS AS THEY FEED EACH OTHER PIECES. Malcolm turns from the television and takes a seat next t He gazes upon his wife softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, I've been so lost. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my best friend. Silence.  Malcolm gazes for a beat before looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. Malcolm's eyes move back up.  He looks at his sleeping wi ANNA'S TALKING IN HER SLEEP. Malcolm can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. Beat.  Her lips move again.  Eyes never open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Malcolm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Anna?  What did I do?  What's  made you so sad? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't leave you. Beat.  She becomes silent.  Anna falls back into deep sle arm slides down.  SOMETHING SHINY FALLS OUT AND ROLLS ON GROUND. Malcolm's eyes watch as it comes to a stop...  Beat.  He curiously at a GOLD WEDDING BAND laying on the wood floor Confusion washes over his face.  He looks to Anna's hand. identical gold wedding ring sits on her finger. Beat.  Malcolm looks down at his own hand...  HIS WEDDING GONE. Malcolm is completely lost.  He takes a couple steps back around in confusion... His eyes come to rest on the door to his basement office. looks in disbelief at the set of DEAD BOLT LOCKS on the d Malcolm doesn't know what the hell's going on...  His eye drawn to the dining table...  Only ONE PLACE SETTING is o the tabletop. His eyes search again -- they finally lock on the WEDDING PLAYING.  Malcolm watches images of himself on the screen eyes fill with a storm of emotions... Malcolm looks to Anna's face and becomes very still.  Bea CLOSE ON ANNA...  TILL HER SLEEPING FACE FILLS THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like he's falling  down a deep hole)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna rushes across the room to a crumpled Malcolm laying floor.  Malcolm's hands are clutched at his side. Anna pries his hands away to reveal the tiniest tear in h shirt.  Anna's eyes catch something dark -- moving...  A BLOOD IS FORMING UNDER MALCOLM.  She slowly turns him ove side...  A horrific sight...  An enormous exit wound on h back pours out blood uncontrollably. Malcolm's jaw is locked open.  His breaths are long and s ANNA IS SCREAMING, BUT HER VOICE SOUNDS FAR AWAY. Malcolm's open jaw releases a long strained breath and th becomes silent.  Anna tries to cover the wound with her h desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) ANNA!

dialogues.speaker: MALCOLM'S VOICE SHAKES THE ROOM.
dialogues.text: Anna just sleeps. Malcolm staggers back.  His breathing erratic. He takes a seat across from her.  He looks at his wife an suddenly becomes very still. Anna's still curled up asleep, but tears are falling from shut eyes. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry. Anna doesn't move, but her tears seem to fall a little fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have to go. Malcolm's mind is racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just needed to do a couple of  things. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I needed to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never second...  Ever. Malcolm gazes at his wife.  Tears fall from both their ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleep now, Anna.  Everything  will be different in the morning. Anna lays still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Malcolm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, sweetheart. The room falls into silence.  Malcolm sits still across f wife.  He drinks her in with his eyes. Malcolm leans back in the chair.  Slowly closes his eyes. close shut.

dialogues.speaker: FALLING BACK INTO A PEACEFUL SLEEP.
dialogues.text: WE PULL BACK to reveal Anna alone in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think I've had too much to  drink. Malcolm smiles as he takes a sip.  The guests chuckle as watch.  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have to say, this day today  has been one very special day...   I wish we all could stay and play. The crowd erupts in LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Malcolm looks around at everyone's smiling faces. Beat.  Malcolm takes his time.  He looks just past the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, I never thought I'd feel the  things I'm feeling.  I never  thought I'd be able to stand up in  front of my friends and family and  tell them what's inside me...   Today I can... Malcolm's eyes fill with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna Crowe...  I am in love.  In  love I am.
